citations.narrative:
Housekeeping. There is a buildup of cobwebs, dust, dirt, and debris on windows, window ledges, bowls and
miscellaneous items stored on window ledges, empty enclosures, walls, and support posts in the guinea pig room. Animal
facilities must be kept clean to ensure good quality of the air for the animals and to prevent unnecessary disease risks.
Ineffective cleaning and housekeeping can expose the animal to disease hazards and health problems. Correct by
ensuring the premises are kept clean, including: removing the buildup of dust, dirt, cobwebs, and debris; routinely dusting
off and cleaning surfaces in animal room; and maintaining a level of general cleanliness to support good animal
husbandry and health.
Remains uncorrected.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.31(b)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
Housekeeping. There is a buildup of cobwebs, dust, dirt, and debris on windows, window ledges, bowls and 
miscellaneous items stored on window ledges, empty enclosures, walls, and support posts in the guinea pig room. Animal 
facilities must be kept clean to ensure good quality of the air for the animals and to prevent  unnecessary disease risks. 
Ineffective  cleaning and housekeeping can expose the animal to disease hazards and health problems. Correct by 
ensuring the premises are kept clean, including: removing  the buildup of dust, dirt, cobwebs, and debris; routinely dusting 
off and cleaning surfaces in animal room; and maintaining a level of general cleanliness to support good animal 
husbandry and health. 
 
Remains uncorrected. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
